descriptions.description: More core developers increase the availability of mentors, facilitating implicit knowledge sharing.
A larger pool of experienced contributors provides more support, attracting and retaining new contributors.
As new contributors gain skills and are promoted, they leave the new contributor stock.
Developer turnover directly reduces the number of core developers through departures.
Promoting experienced contributors directly increases the stock of core developers.
Promoting experienced contributors directly reduces their stock as they move to the core group.
As new contributors develop skills, they flow into the stock of experienced contributors.
Better documentation provides accessible knowledge, accelerating the skill development process.
Effective mentorship accelerates learning by providing personalized guidance and tacit knowledge.
Mentorship prepares experienced contributors for core responsibilities, increasing their promotion rate.
